html:
as he was worshiping. As Sennacherib worships his god Nisroch in his temple in Nineveh, he is murdered by two of his sons, Adrammelech and Sharezer. His god failed to protect him—an ironic contrast to Hezekiah's prayer at the temple (37:15-20) and subsequent deliverance from his enemies (not to mention the irony of Sennacherib's message to Hezekiah in Isa. 36:14-20 not to rely on the Lord because the Lord would not save him).

Esar-haddon. Esarhaddon, Sennacherib's youngest son, inherits his father's throne in 681 b.c.
